wikipedia_page.main:
Ollie Lindsay-Hague (born 8 October 1990) is a professional rugby union player, who played for Harlequin F.C.Lindsay-Hague is a versatile member of the squad having played wing, fullback and also scrum-half for the club.
He was educated at Hall School Wimbledon and Millfield School where he was Sevens captain. He first played pro rugby at London Welsh, while also representing the England Under 16 A team as well as playing for England in 7s.Lindsay-Hague was selected to represent Great Britain at the 2016 Summer Olympics in Rugby sevens. It was announced in August 2016 that he was leaving Harlequins.In August 2021, it was announced that Lindsay-Hague would join Newcastle Falcons and return to the 15-a-side format.
